title: [K-12] Virtual Reality-Based Mathematics Microlearning Design: Short-Term Intensive Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts, basic proficiency in VR device usage
context.additional_context: Secures accessibility via smartphone-based VR devices, provides real-time feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can explain geometric concepts (e.g., calculating the volume of 3D shapes) with 80% accuracy using microlearning content under 5 minutes in iVR environments.
Learners can solve foundational algebraic equations (linear/quadratic) presented in interactive problems within VR simulations with 75% accuracy.
Learners can identify and select three or more formats optimized for their learning style among microlearning modules (text/video/presentation).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
